title: Storage jar (hu)
text: Late Chou potters freely borrowed ritual bronze vessel shapes. Animal and geometric designs are incised into the sides of this clay vessel. These, along with the applied mask handles, imitate a type of inlaid bronze <I>hu<I> associated with northern fifth and fourth century b.c. bronze workshops.
description: vase, pottery, Hu pear-shaped body, imitation of a bronze type, as is proved by the presence on the shoulders, of two animal heads with loops for pendent rings; The decoration expressed in incised line, combines geometric patterns with stylized tiger forms on a black surface.
